home.dateAnnouncement: are delighted to invite you to their wedding
home.welcome: We can't wait to celebrate with you!
home.ourStoryText: We met in the most wonderful and unexpected way. After an incredible proposal under the Northern Lights, we are delighted to have announced our marriage and would love to share this special day with you.

schedule.title: Wedding Schedule
schedule.subtitle: Join us for a weekend of celebration

ceremony.title: Church Ceremony
ceremony.description: Join us for our church wedding ceremony at the beautiful Rheingauer Dom in Geisenheim.

reception.title: Reception & Celebration
reception.description: After a short drive, we'll continue the celebration at Burg Schwarzenstein with dinner, dancing, and festivities that will go deep into the night.

brunch.title: Sunday Brunch
brunch.description: Join us the next morning for a relaxed brunch at a beautiful restaurant near the church, overlooking the Rhine River. A perfect way to extend our celebration and say farewell.

venue.title: The Venue
venue.subtitle: Burg Schwarzenstein
venue.description: A stunning Relais & Châteaux hotel nestled in the heart of the Rheingau wine region. This historic castle, surrounded by rolling vineyards, offers breathtaking views and world-class hospitality.

region.title: The Rheingau Region
region.description: The Rheingau is one of Germany's most prestigious wine regions, famous for its exceptional Riesling wines. Nestled along the Rhine River, this picturesque region features charming villages, historic monasteries, and endless vineyards stretching across sun-drenched hillsides.

explore.title: Staying a Bit Longer?
explore.description: If you're able to extend your stay beyond the wedding, we warmly encourage you to make the most of the region. The Rheingau and surrounding area offer so much to discover—from visiting castles and historic sites to wine tastings at local estates, scenic drives along the Rhine, and charming villages to explore. However long you stay, we hope you enjoy every moment.

travel.title: Getting There
travel.subtitle: How to reach Burg Schwarzenstein
travel.intro: The venue is located approximately 30 minutes from Frankfurt, making it easily accessible by various means of transportation.

byAir.title: By Air
byAir.description: Fly into Frankfurt Airport (FRA), one of Europe's largest hubs with excellent international connections. The airport also has a major train station (Frankfurt Flughafen Fernbahnhof) for easy onward travel.

byTrain.title: By Train
byTrain.description: Take a train to Frankfurt Hauptbahnhof (main station) or Frankfurt Airport station. From there, you can rent a car, take a taxi, or arrange a transfer to the venue.

byCar.title: By Car
byCar.description: If driving, the venue is easily accessible via the A66 motorway. There is ample parking available at Burg Schwarzenstein.

lastMile.title: Getting to the Venue
lastMile.description: Since the castle is about 30 minutes from Frankfurt, we recommend:

options.rental: Renting a car - gives you flexibility to explore the beautiful region
options.taxi: Taking a taxi or Uber from Frankfurt

accommodationNote.title: Where to Stay
accommodationNote.description: There are plenty of Airbnbs and hotels in the area. We will be staying at a hotel ourselves—if you would like to book a room at the same hotel when you come for our wedding, you are very welcome to do so.

churchToVenue.title: From Church to the Venue
churchToVenue.description: If you come to the church by taxi or Uber, don't worry about the rest of the way: we will take care of getting you to the venue. It's only a 5–10 minute drive between the church and Burg Schwarzenstein, and someone will be there to help.

accommodation.title: Where to Stay
accommodation.subtitle: Accommodation options for all preferences and budgets

castle.title: Stay at the Castle
castle.description: We have reserved a limited number of rooms at Burg Schwarzenstein for our guests. This is a wonderful opportunity to stay where the celebration takes place and enjoy the full experience.
castle.booking: To book a room at the castle, please contact us directly:
castle.note: Rooms are limited and will be allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.
castle.extendStay: Rooms are reserved for the wedding night. If you would like to stay until Sunday or longer, simply let us know and we will arrange with the hotel to keep your preferred room for the extra nights.

gaestezimmer160.name: Gästezimmer (1.60m bed)
gaestezimmer160.description: Cozy guest room with larger bed

juniorSuite.name: Junior Suite
juniorSuite.description: Elegant suite with separate living area

airbnb.title: Airbnb & Vacation Rentals
airbnb.description: The Rheingau wine region offers amazing Airbnb options! Stay in a charming vineyard cottage, a traditional German wine estate, or a cozy apartment with stunning valley views. This is a great way to immerse yourself in the local atmosphere.

hotels.title: Nearby Hotels
hotels.description: There are excellent hotels in the area at various price points, from cozy guesthouses to luxury accommodations. Some options include hotels in Geisenheim, Rüdesheim, and Wiesbaden.

contact.description: For room reservations at the castle or any accommodation questions:

monetary.title: Honeymoon Fund
monetary.description: We are going on our honeymoon in Japan right after the wedding, and we are furnishing our new apartment in Berlin. A monetary gift is definitely the most welcome.
monetary.cashOnSite: A letter with cash on the day is also completely fine.
